discussion.content: Is there a table showing what "services" the 5000 supports vs. the 7000?

comments.content:
Not a table but this link enumerates the feature sets.

http://www.firewall.cx/cisco-technical-knowledgebase/cisco-data-center/1201-introduction-nexus-family-nx-os-ios-differences.html
The key one is OTV - both the 5k and 7k support FabricPath, FCoE, and L3.

questions.question_text:
You are designing a network that provides FCoE, FabricPath, OTV, and Layer 3 functionalities.
Which device can perform these functionalities?
A customer wants to connect to their SAN via Fibre Channel. Which two devices can be used to provide connectivity? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Nexus 7000 is out (it has no native FC support)
Cat 6500 doesn't support DC services.
FEX is a dumb device. All config info is in the parent switch.

So, that leaves the MDS 9148 and Nexus 5548UP switch.
What is stateFUL and not stateLESS the answer?

questions.question_text: Which network device is used to identify and protect against unauthorized traffic and control access to legitimate business-critical data?

discussion.content: This is wrong. The Data link and Physical layers are combined into the Network Interface layer. In addition, the Application, Presentation, and and Session layers are combined into the Application layer of the TCP/IP model.

comments.content: Yes, a better wording would be which two layers are 'combined with' or 'combined into' the application layer (e.g. for a total of three layers).

questions.question_text: Which two layers of the OSI model are combined in the Internet protocol suite application layer? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The answers with UDP and TCP were the "giveaways" here.

questions.question_text: Which two options are groups of network protocols that are categorized into the following OSI layers: application, data link, network, and transport? (Choose two.)
